head.title: Metro Briefing | New York: Manhattan: St. Vincent Gets New Chief

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Manhattan: St. Vincent Gets New Chief
hedline.hl2: Manhattan: St. Vincent Gets New Chief

block.p: The chief executive of Catholic Health and Human Services in New Jersey has been selected to become the next president of St. Vincent Catholic Medical Centers, the Manhattan-based hospital and health care network, officials at St. Vincent announced yesterday. The new president, Henry Amoroso, will lead St. Vincent as it works to emerge from Chapter 11 bankruptcy this summer, officials said. In addition to leading the Newark-based hospital and charity system, Mr. Amoroso was principal adviser on urban health care to Mayor Cory A. Booker of Newark, officials said.
